job_title: S&C - Strategy Consultant in Automotive/Mobility or Industrial
job_description:
About the job
            
 
We are looking for passionate, curious and driven team players who are ready to ignite ideas, push boundaries and drive innovation. At Accenture you’ll work on innovative projects and develop your career, collaborating with the best teams in the world. You'll learn, grow and advance in an innovative culture that thrives on shared success, diverse ways of thinking and enables boundaryless opportunities that can drive your career in new and exciting ways. About AccentureAccenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services at scale in strategy and consulting, interactive, technology and operations, with digital capabilities across all off these services.We combine unmatched experience and specialized capabilities across more than 40 industries – powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. With 513,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, Accenture brings continuous innovation to help clients improve their performance and create lasting value across their enterprises. Working closely with clients our Strategy & Consulting professionals help transform the world’s leading organizations, working across the C-suite to capitalize innovation.Role & Key AccountabilitiesTake part to strategic projects to ensure their success and maximize business impactAct as the nexus between analysts of the project team and the leadership involved in the deliveryManage, train and contribute to the development of the junior profiles within the teamRequirements3-5 years experience in consulting or project management in a fast-paced environmentTop Business or Engineering SchoolPreferred SkillsStrategy Consulting Experience in Automotive, Mobility and IndustrialAbility to execute projects and bring innovation to our clientsResults-driven, strong analytics mindset.Problem solver, process oriented, ability to foster team spirit and performanceExcellent written and oral communication skills with ability to clearly communicate ideas and results on all organization levelsDrive, ambition and initiative to help grow Accenture´s business at functional and Industry levelPeople development and team building skillsFluent in Spanish and English is mandatoryWhat You Will Get From UsPermanent contract with competitive salary.Great benefits such as a health insurance with 90% premium covered, life insurance and Flexible Salary.Referral Bonus if you reference professional colleagues.Flexible working hours with intensive workdays for two months and a half in summer. Different formats for family reconciliation.English trainings, conferences and certifications.Accenture Privilege (a lot of discounts in several products such as traveling, banking, IT products and restaurants).GymPass.Free coffee and fresh fruit in the office.You can be a part of our LGTBY Ally employees’ group.Accenture is an equal opportunities employer and welcomes applications from all sections of society and does not discriminate on grounds of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, or gender identity, or any other basis as protected by applicable law.

About the job
            
 
Location: London | Munich | Sao Paolo | Amsterdam | GlobalPositionWe are now expanding our incredibly diverse & talented pool of independent consultants as we continue our global system-change mission.We’re hiring at all levels, from Associate to Director level equivalents to work on mission driven & pure play impact focused projects that have a substantial, lasting effect on the world we live in.About SystemiqSystemiq, the systems change company and certified B Corp, was founded to drive the achievement of the UN Sustainable Development Goals and the Paris Agreement on climate change by transforming markets and business models in five key systems: nature and food, materials, and circular economy, energy, urban areas, and sustainable finance.We are guided by the conviction that all system transformations are rooted in human transformations. We must continue to bring more diverse people and voices into real conversations to succeed. We know we don’t have all the answers; we may not even have all the right questions. But we know that open mindsets drive change, so relationships, people, and trust are at the heart of everything we do.Why work with Systemiq?Are you ready to further your career whilst actively contributing to a greener, more regenerative & sustainable world? At Systemiq, we're not just a b corp consultancy firm; we're a community of passionate professionals dedicated to creating positive change. Here's why you should consider joining us as an independent consultant.Mission-Driven Global Impact: At Systemiq, you'll be part of global hybrid teams working towards a shared goal – a more sustainable and environmentally-conscious future. Every project you work on will have a direct impact on the planet and society. Your work won't just be a job; it will be a mission to leave a positive, lasting legacy.Inclusivity and acceptance: Systemiq Independent consultants are fostered into an inclusive environment where a whole range of diverse individuals are highly valued for their unique perspectives and contributions to commercial and intellectual Systems thinking. We will hold in high regard your experience including everything you have done outside of consulting as well.Flexibility and Accommodation We will encourage you tailor your work arrangements to your specific needs.Collaborative Environment: Our culture is built on collaboration and innovation. You'll be working with a team of experts who are not only committed to making sustainable systems more investible and regenerative, but also eager to share knowledge and ideas. Together, we tackle complex challenges, finding creative solutions which enables positive Systems change.Networking: As part of our independent contractor network, you will connect with influential figures across multiple sectors relating to sustainability and the environment. We regularly collaborate with industry leaders, leading to unique networking opportunities and helping you expand your professional reach.Requirements 2-10 + years professional experience in relevant fields: (advisory/consulting, strategy, thought leadership/research, industry, project management, investment).Where specifically needed for front line Systemiq strategy projects, at least 1-2 of these years would typically be from a top tier strategy consultancy. Typically, BCG, Bain, Mck, and other top management consulting firms.Exceptional problem solving, analytical and structuring skills with high level of comfort & enthusiasm for delivering intuitive presentations of complex data.Intellectual and commercial curiosity with an interest to quickly dive into new topics,Collaborative team player and can-do attitude.Understanding of key concepts and contexts within one or more of the following topic areas of materials and circularity, sustainable finance, urban environment, industry, energy, or agriculture/land use will be a distinct advantage.Evidenced passion for SYSTEMIQ's mission and the sustainability / environment / social enterprise space.Alignment with SYSTEMIQ's values (creativity, challenge, collaborate, change, care).
Other information Please note, due to the high volume of applications we receive we are not able to respond individually to everyone
Diversity & InclusionWe believe that diversity and inclusion are at the heart of system change and the mission we have set ourselves. So we commit ourselves to:· Embedding diverse and inclusive ways of working from day to day. This includes recruitment, performance management, and people processes and policies.· Providing a supportive environment. We want people to be themselves and be at their best, regardless of their background, personality, gender, sexual orientation, race, mental health, religion, or other characteristics.· Enabling a long-term, sustainable approach to work and life more generally. We want to support our people at all stages of their lives – as parents or caregivers, through changing life circumstances – and to accommodate personal priorities where they matter most

About the job
            
 
EMERTONEmerton is a global high-end strategy consulting firm based in Paris, London, Munich and New York. We support global corporations and fast-growth companies on their high-stake issues with a focus on Technology and Industry. We bring speed and advanced capabilities to our clients in designing and executing innovative strategies.Emerton is the partner of choice of international groups, technology companies and private equity funds. The firm supports the development acceleration, acquisition policy, international expansion, digital transformation and technological implementation of their clients.Emerton is ranked by Vault (2022) among the top 20 consulting firms in Europe and among top 10 for its Diversity and Inclusion policy.JOB DESCRIPTIONIn close contact with clients and partners, and under the guidance of a senior consultant or manager, you conduct interviews, market analysis and corporate performance assessments. You analyze facts and data, and translate them into meaningful insights and recommendations. After an onboarding period with tailor-made trainings, you will immediately put your talent, analytical capabilities and creativity in action within a project team.WHAT WE OFFER- Fast-learning strategy consulting mindset and methods- International, diverse and inclusive environment- Culture of excellence- Strong team bonding- High-impact projects including sustainable development- Strong client exposure- Competitive compensation and benefits- Fast-growth entrepreneurial company offering many opportunitiesWHO WE LOOK FORHigh-potential individuals willing to work in a challenging international environment- Top-tier academic background (top-ranked engineering or business school)- Proven analytical and creative thinking- Sharp problem-solving capabilities- Strong business sense- Excellent oral and written communication skills

About the job
            
 
Who are we? Mantu is an independent international consulting player, founded in 2007. Bringing together expert and complementary brands, Mantu stands out for the breadth of its spectrum, responding to all business transformation challenges. Its activities are divided into four practices: Leadership & Advocacy, Technology, Digital Marketing & Experience, Total Talent Management.A wide range of skills, all serving a single mission: connecting and powering companies with leading teams and technology to succeed faster and sustainably.From its headquarters in Geneva, Switzerland, Mantu relies on a community of 10,000 talented people in more than 60 countries on 5 continents and has a turnover of 810 million euros.Job description Valuement is an international consulting company, part of Mantu Group, operating in 60 countries, with a primary focus on the retail market and now also expanding new industries. Successful candidates will have the opportunity to be part of an international, young and fast growing group with real opportunities for professional development at all levels.We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Consultant with a background in the retail fashion industry. This position is based in Milan and requires 3 years of relevant experience in consulting, preferably within the Retail sector.Key Responsibilities: Project Management: Manage end-to-end consulting project activities, including project scoping, planning, execution, and delivery.Ensure projects are delivered within agreed timelines, budgets, and quality standards.Business Development: Support business development efforts by identifying new opportunities within the retail fashion industry.Participate in client pitches, proposal development, and lead generation activities.Client Relationship Management: Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, acting as a trusted advisor and understanding their unique business needs.Collaborate closely with clients to develop and implement strategic initiatives that align with their goals.Strategic Analysis: Conduct in-depth analysis of the retail fashion market, including market trends, consumer behavior, competitive landscape, and industry best practices.Translate findings into actionable insights and strategic recommendations for clients.Digital innovation: participate in the functional development of IT solutions (workflow, RPA) that can help customers in the digital innovation process.Qualifications and Skills: -Master's degree in Business Administration, Management or a related field.-3 years of experience in strategic consulting, preferably with a focus on the retail fashion industry.-Proven track record of delivering strategic consulting projects, driving tangible results for clients.-Positive approach and ability to work as a team, with experience in manage other people.-Strong communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively communicate complex ideas to stakeholders at all levels.-Fluency in English and Italian is required. Additional languages are a plus.What we offer: Permanent contract + commissions and benefits; Real possibility to grow fast into a management role; International environment, Overseas projects to develop and mobility opportunities.

About the job
            
 
Management ConsultantVan ‘financial economic crime’ tot ‘digital transformation’. En van ‘target operating models’ tot ‘post-merger integration’ trajecten. Onder deze termen schuilt een fascinerende wereld die blijft verrassen. Een wereld waarin er altijd iets nieuws te ontdekken is. Delta Capita helpt banken, verzekeraars, pensioenfondsen en toezichthouders om slim in te spelen op de veranderingen van een financiële markt die zich in razend tempo ontwikkelt.Als management consultant begeleid je klanten bij uiteenlopende vraagstukken. Denk aan het realiseren van een efficiëntere operatie bij een bank, het integreren van bedrijfsonderdelen of de implementatie van een nieuw pensioenstelsel bij een pensioenuitvoerder. Jij stuurt het team aan en bent verantwoordelijk voor een succesvolle oplevering van de opdracht. De casussen zijn uitdagend en de structuren zijn complex. Precies zoals wij het graag hebben.Bij Delta Capita werk je in een hecht team van bevlogen en internationale collega’s. Collega’s die het beste van zichzelf én van jou vragen. Al onze teamleden krijgen dan ook veel vrijheid en verantwoordelijkheid in de invulling van hun werk. Wij geven je de ruimte om écht het verschil te maken.Onze mensen vormen de kracht van Delta Capita. De talenten, toewijding en passie van ons hele team bepalen het succes van onze organisatie. Daarom zorgen wij graag goed voor al onze collega’s. We willen een werkplek bieden waarin verschillen gevierd worden en iedereen zich thuis voelt. Een plek waar jij alle mogelijkheden hebt om je volledige potentieel te verkennen en realiseren. We werken hard, maar maken ook tijd voor gezelligheid met borrels, prikkelende teamactiviteiten en legendarische teamuitjes.Haal het beste uit jezelf bij Delta CapitaLeren, ontwikkelen en steeds beter worden in wat je doet. Bij Delta Capita gaan we er niet vanuit dat dat vanzelf gaat. Samen met jouw manager bepaal je tijdens regelmatige contactmomenten persoonlijke ontwikkelingsdoelstellingen. Hoe je die behaalt? Onder andere met behulp van onze geaccrediteerde Delta Capita Academy, interne kennissessies, en trainingen zowel vanuit onze wereldwijde organisatie als externe partijen.De Financial Times noemde Delta Capita een van de snelst groeiende bedrijven van Europa. We zijn een scale-up die nét een beetje anders opereert dan de traditionele consultancybureaus. Onze organisatie kent weinig lagen en is wars van hiërarchie en bureaucratie. We bieden dus veel vrijheid en meer dan genoeg kansen om snel te groeien. Wij houden van ondernemende geesten en geven je veel ruimte om initiatieven te ontplooien en het beste uit jezelf te halen.Delta Capita is een internationale organisatie. Ons hoofdkantoor staat in Londen, maar we hebben ook vestigingen in onder andere Singapore, Dublin, Frankfurt, Hong Kong, New York en natuurlijk Amsterdam. Bij ons heb je dan ook de mogelijkheid om opdrachten te doen die de grens over gaan.Waar staan wij voor?Reinventing the financial services value chain. Dat is waar Delta Capita dagelijks aan werkt. Wij geloven in een vernieuwde financiële sector. Een sector die bijdraagt aan een duurzamere wereld om haar klanten beter van dienst te kunnen zijn. Om dat te realiseren, ontwikkelen en implementeren wij nieuwe producten en diensten die de status quo uitdagen en verandering veroorzaken in de sector.In onze wereldwijde organisatie staan diversiteit en inclusiviteit hoog in het vaandel.Met vestigingen op drie continenten zijn wij een multicultureel bedrijf dat de kracht kent van uiteenlopende perspectieven, achtergronden en levenservaringen. Samen excelleren voor een betere wereld. Daar geloven wij in.Onze kernwaardenMet lef, daadkracht en professionaliteit werkt Delta Capita samen om betere uitkomsten te realiseren. We zijn betrokken in ons werk, direct in onze communicatie en leren en innoveren snel. Zo zetten we verandering in gang en overtreffen we de verwachtingen van onze klanten in alles wat we doen.Wie ben jij? Master diploma behaald, bij voorkeur in business, economics of financeMinstens 3 tot 7 jaar werkervaring, bij voorkeur in de consultancy en/of financiële sectorVloeiend Nederlands en Engels, zowel in geschrift als mondelingOndernemend en met een passie voor vernieuwen, verbeteren en innoverenCommunicatief vaardig. Op professioneel niveau kun je omgaan met mensen uit alle levels van een organisatieAffiniteit met coaching en een positieve drive die je goed kunt overbrengen op de rest van het teamSterke analytische vaardigheden en oog voor detailStreeft altijd naar een maximale teamprestatie
Wat bieden wij? Een salaris tussen de 4000 en 7000 euro per maand excl. vakantiegeld, afhankelijk van jouw jaren werkervaring en senioriteitDe keuze voor een contract van 32 tot 40 uur26 vakantiedagen per jaarDe mogelijkheid om deels thuis te werken, inclusief faciliteiten voor een thuiswerkplekEen jaarlijkse prestatiebonus, op basis van bedrijfsresultaten en je eigen prestatieKeuze tussen een NS-business card of een kilometervergoedingGoede pensioenregelingToegang tot een uitgebreid, internationaal learning & development programma met ruimte voor individuele ontwikkelingstrajecten
Waarom Delta Capita?  Informele organisatiestructuur met korte lijnen waarin je de vrijheid hebt om jouw eigen kansen te creëren en snel door te groeienEen gezellig team met internationale en ambitieuze collega’sEen kantoor in Amsterdam met alle faciliteiten om optimaal te kunnen presterenRuimte om tijd te besteden aan goede doelen en andere initiatieven die een positief effect hebben op de samenlevingDe mogelijkheid om een sabbatical op te nemenAandacht voor financial & mental well-being

job_title: Strategy Consultant (m/f/d) in Hamburg or Munich
job_description:
About the job
            
 
TTE Strategy is an independent and multiple-award-winning, #1 boutique consultancy specializing in strategy and transformation. Founded in 2015, we advise and support clients around the globe on matters of strategy, operations, commercial excellence, and the digital transformation. We are based in Hamburg and Munich, Germany, and Zug, Switzerland.WE ARE LOOKING FOR:STRATEGY CONSULTANT (m/f/d) in Hamburg or MunichThis is what YOU are looking for: A real growth adventure during which your contribution has a tangible impact. A way of consulting that is not only about PowerPoint presentations but results. A place to learn and grow, with an emphasis on what really brings you further – not what’s on a formal development plan. A team that seizes opportunities together.This is how YOU are: Enthusiastic, creative, and able to inspire – even on a beginner’s level. Hands-on and proactive. Open to constant learning and improving yourself and others. Ready to build a new leading brand in the consulting market together with us.This is what YOU need: A master’s degree with excellent grades. Experience in business thanks to internships or a maximum of 2 years in consulting. Strong skills in analytical and structured thinking. Solid know-how of established software. Fluent in English. Willingness to travel. And, ultimately, the ability to have fun within a great team.So, if you really read all these lines up to here …This is what WE offer you:Become a CREATOR of solutions for TTE clients and our growth company from day 1.Including: Working within a low hierarchy, directly with management and the TTE team, along with the guarantee that your ideas will not only be heard but also taken seriouslyBecome the DRIVER of your own learning curve.Including: Direct coaching from and sparring with your project leader, along with the guarantee that you will benefit from at least 2 high-profile external trainings per year that you select together with usBecome a great TEAMMATE and live up our international family spirit.Including: Prime office locations, regular team events, and the guarantee of a casual, family-like atmosphere of diverse, like-minded expertsBe appreciated and valued as a HUMAN, not as a resource.Including: Mental health programs, a mobility budget, and the guarantee of flexibility and remote workDoes this EXCITE you?Let’s get in touch. Now. We can’t wait to get to know you!For a first conversation, please send your CV with references to career@tte-strategy.com

About the job
            
 
Can’t wait to make an impact on the world? You’re not alone. Join us in driving progress in the working world and beyond. Your journey with us As a member of our Strategy and Performance team, you will help our clients to address business-critical issues, and support management teams in finding solutions to answering complex strategic dilemmas. Based on thorough market research and our strong strategic methodologies, you advise SME’s in the different strategic options to face the challenges of today and tomorrow.You will contribute to a wide range of projects across various industries, helping our clients cope with the challenges they are facing, linked to the corporate, sustainability, customer and/or digital strategy of the SME;Build strong market knowledge in order to obtain a strong sector understand to give clients insights in market trends, which will affect their current business;Provide our clients with a forward-looking view of the most important strategic topics affecting them; Support the client in determining its strategy and defining the right set of initiatives & projects to execute upon this strategy;You will advise family owned (private) companies with their growth challenges, transformation or international ambitions; the majority of the clients are located in Wallonia and Brussels; you will work with the management team and very often the owner of the company; Scope and deliver engagements, including leading the approach, liaising with stakeholders, and directing activities of people on the project team;Provide professional development opportunities and feedback for junior team members;Challenge the management of the companies with a critical mindset and based on strong (market) analysis;Prepare with the team market research and workshops; being able to facilitate workshops with management; delivering high quality strategic report based on a thorough understanding of the client challenges and profound (market) analysis.
 Let’s talk about youSuccessful candidates will have a degree from a top-tier academic institution, have minimum 5 years of relevant business experience, and the ability to meet each of the following criteria: Excellent academic credentials for both undergraduate and graduate coursework, MBA is a plus;A minimum of 5 years of previous work experience with a top consultancy practice, strategy house in SME market or internal strategy teams within a large companyHaving a strong affinity and interest in family owned (private) companiesProven track record in dealing with growth and transformation issues/strategies such as market expansion, customer insights, profitability management, etc.;Outstanding interpersonal and communication skills (including presentations), both written and verbal;Leadership qualities, project management skills, and people management and development skills with a strong focus on team development;Have a creative mind set, dare to think out of the box with an analytical touch;Ability to lead and direct cross functional teams;Strong skills to work with MS Powerpoint and MS Excel;Fluency in French & English, preferably also in Dutch 
Personal Qualities Valued: Intellectually powerful and agile: curious, pragmatic, rigorous, and creative;Be able to set up partnerships with colleagues and stakeholders. Be a trusted advisor, who is comfortable with working on difficult issues where there can be no definitive “right” answer; patient in the face of uncertainty, complexity and ambiguity;Capable of working on multiple, overlapping tasks in a fast-paced environment;Able to take initiative and make things happen with moderate supervision and guidance.
 Accounting is so much more than hard numbers. Think analysis, critical insights, problem-solving and strategic planning. The magic happens when analysis and insight meld. It’s what turns accountants into trusted advisors who use regulatory compliance and reporting to create opportunities and manage risk for our clients. At Deloitte, we advise a wide range of companies across multidisciplinary services ranging from accounting, tax, legal, mergers and acquisitions to services such as “business control & technology” and “strategy & growth” tailor-made solutions. At the same time, our team of advisors handles cases with a satellite vision, enthusiasm and know-how. Part of the Accountancy family, the Strategy & Performance team offers family businesses & SME's clear strategic directions, monitor their businesses and transform their operations. Think analysis, critical insights, problem-solving and strategic planning. The magic happens when analysis and actions meld, to bring organizations to the next level. It's what turns Deloitte into a trusted advisor. Who is Deloitte? World-leading professional services firm, we offer value added services in audit & assurance, risk advisory, accounting, tax & legal, consulting and financial advisory. +6000 dedicated professionals, active in +10 offices throughout the country, take great pride in supporting our clients with multidisciplinary expertise, industry knowledge, and innovative solutions.  We offer services to a wide variety of clients, from national and international companies, small, fast-growing and large organizations to public institutions and governmental authorities.Why Deloitte? Be the true you! We foster diversity and inclusion and encourage you to bring your authentic self to work. Explore, question and collaborate while building a career that inspires and energises you. Never stop growing! Diversity of thought makes us stronger. At Deloitte, we tailor a personalized learning experience, offering you the opportunity to grow at your own pace and achieve maximum impact. We practice what we preach! As a Purpose-led organisation, at the heart of everything we do is a set of timeless principles and unifying values.Life looks different for each of us, so we created a varied benefits package that you can tap into:  My Benefits My Choice, a flexible rewards plan tailored to your lifestyle and prioritiesSustainable transport options offered by Mobility@Deloitte Flexible work arrangements for all and initiatives supported by Parents@Deloitte Wellbeing tips and activities powered by Energise@Deloitte Topped off with other health benefits and insurance opportunities
Empowering our employees with flexible work arrangements remains essential in today's reality:  Hybrid workplace: combination of home office and on-site (+10 offices in Belgium or client's premises). Part-time employment: all our jobs are open to part-time work under a 90% or 80% regime.
Join us to make an impact together! Apply now!
